commands.description: Used to change the current working directory. For example, 'cd /home/user' moves you into the /home/user directory.
Lists the contents of the current directory. Options like '-l' provide more detail about each file.
Prints the current working directory path.
Creates a new directory. For example, 'mkdir myfolder' creates a folder named myfolder.
Removes files or directories. Using '-r' (recursive) can remove entire directories.
